svg.title: Short-Circuit Coordination — Quick Panel
svg.desc: Conceptual selection of upstream fuse and downstream MCCB using I_fl and I_sc; ensure Icu > I_sc and proper grading.
svg.text: Select devices so: Upstream fuse clears higher faults; downstream MCCB protects load; Icu ≥ I_sc at location.

g.text: Transformer: S = 100 kVA, V_sec = 0.433 kV; I_fl ≈ 133 A (3Φ) ; I_sc at LV bus ≈ 10 kA (example)
Loads: Feeder MCCB; upstream HV fuse or upstream MCCB
• Magnetic (instantaneous): above inrush/starting but < upstream device
• Breaking capacity Icu ≥ local I_sc (e.g., 15 kA @ 415 V)
• Ensure cable withstand (I²t) & selectivity with upstream
• HV fuse curve above LV MCCB for selectivity
• Rated to clear max source fault; energy let‑through compatible
• If MCCB upstream: use higher settings; maintain grading gap
• Check transformer inrush (8–12×) vs instantaneous pickup
Tip: Plot TCCs (time‑current curves) for exact devices to verify selectivity (zone‑selective interlocking where available).
